00051 /// 386 systems cant map more than 2GB of user memory.
00052 /// (unless you have a patched kernel...)
00053 #ifdef WIN32
00054 #ifdef _WIN64
00055 #define MEMINFO_2GB_MAX (2UL*1024*1024*1024)
00056 #else
00057 // cap at 1.3G on Windows due to expected memory fragmentation
00058 /// @todo This was 1.7G on head before merge with python branch. Further work on genotype engine may allow for bumping this back up some.
00059 #define MEMINFO_2GB_MAX floor(1.3f*1024*1024*1024)
00060 #endif
00061 #else
00062 #define MEMINFO_2GB_MAX (2UL*1024*1024*1024)
00063 #endif

00065 /// Log base two
00066 #define log2(x) ( log((x))/log((2.0)) )
00067 /// Square of the two numbers
00068 /// (Note: this is bad style due to X being evaled twice.)
00069 #define sqr(x) ((x)*(x))
00070 
00071 /// Returns the number of elements in the array.
00072 #define ArraySize(a) (sizeof(a)/sizeof((a)[0]))

00074 /** delete function that deletes the pointer and sets it to NULL. */
00075 template<class T> inline void Freez(T*& p) { delete p; p = NULL; }
00076 /** delete function that deletes an array and sets the pointer to NULL. */
00077 template<class T> inline void FreezArray(T*& p) { delete[] p; p = NULL; }

00079 /**
00080  * @name InstanceOf
00081  *
00082  * Check at run time if an object is an instance of a class.  This differs from
00083  * comparing the result of type_id, as it takes inheritance into account.  Note
00084  * that base class must be polymorphic, that is it must have a virtual function
00085  * or inherit from another class.
00086  *
00087  * @param objPtr A pointer to the object to check.  A pointer must be used, not
00088  * an object.  If necessary, generate an address.
00089  * @param The class name to test against.
00090  * @return true if the object is an instance of the class.
00091  */
00092 #define InstanceOf(objPtr, className) \
00093     ((bool)(dynamic_cast<const className*>(objPtr) != NULL))
00094

00102   /**
00103    * Make the string all lowercase.
00104    * @param s - string to be modified
00105    */
00106   static void downcaseString_inplace(std::string& str) {
00107     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
00108       str[i] = (char)tolower(str[i]);
00109     }
00110   }
00111   /// @brief     Copy and downcase a 8bit string.
00112   /// @param     str_orig
00113   /// @return
00114   static std::string downcaseString(const std::string& str_orig) {
00115     std::string str=str_orig;
00116     downcaseString_inplace(str);
00117     return str;
00118   }
00119 
00120 
00121   /**
00122    * Make the string all uppercase.
00123    * @param s - string to be modified
00124    */
00125   static void upcaseString_inplace(std::string& str) {
00126     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
00127       str[i] = (char)toupper(str[i]);
00128     }
00129   }
00130   /// @brief     Copy and upcase a 8bit string.
00131   /// @param     str_orig
00132   /// @return
00133   static std::string upcaseString(const std::string& str_orig) {
00134     std::string str=str_orig;
00135     upcaseString_inplace(str);
00136     return str;
00137   }

00139   /** Comparison object for use in map for char * */
00140    struct ltstr {
00141      /// Is one string less than another?
00142      bool operator()(const char* s1, const char* s2) const {
00143       return strcmp(s1, s2) < 0;
00144      }
00145    };
00146 
00147    struct ltstring {
00148      /// Is one string less than another?
00149      bool operator()(const std::string& s1, const std::string& s2) const {
00150        return strcmp(s1.c_str(), s2.c_str()) < 0;
00151        //return s1.compare(s2)<0; //vliber
00152      }
00153    };

00234   /**
00235    * @brief Cut off any preceding and trailing white space.
00236    * @param s - String to be trimmed.
00237    * @param whitespace - String with characters to be trimmed.
00238    */
00239   static void trimString(std::string& s, const char *whitespace  = " \r\n\t") {
00240     s = s.erase(s.find_last_not_of(whitespace)+1);
00241     s = s.erase(0,s.find_first_not_of(whitespace));
00242   }

00265     return s1.compare(s2) == 0;

00268   /**
00269    * Check each entry in two matrices to see if they are the same.  If
00270    * doing 'match-rows' we will attempt to find the matching row by the
00271    * row name.
00272    *
00273    * @param targetFile - File to read target matrix from.
00274    * @param queryFile - File to read the query matrix from.
00275    * @param colSkip - How many of initial columns to ignore (i.e. row names)
00276    * @param rowSkip - How many of initial rows to ignore (i.e. column header)
00277    * @param epsilon - What is the tolerance of difference.
00278    *                  i.e. if q[i][j] - t[i][j] >= epsilon then there is a difference.
00279    * @param printMismatch - Should we print out the cases where difference is >= epsilon
00280    * @param matchRows - Should we try to match the rows based on the row identifiers.
00281    * @param fraction - Maximum fractional difference considered equivalent (default: not used).
00282    * @param printMismatchMax - Maximum number of mismatches to print (default: no limit).
00283    *
00284    * @return - Number of differences >= epsilon found.
00285    */
00286   static int matrixDifferences(const std::string& targetFile,
00287                                const std::string& queryFile,
00288                                int colSkip, int rowSkip,
00289                                double epsilon,
00290                                bool printMismatch,
00291                                bool matchRows,
00292                                double fraction = 0.0,
00293                                int printMismatchMax = -1);

00295   /**
00296    * Replace the from character with the to character for
00297    * all instances in string supplied.
00298    *
00299    * @param s - string to do the replacement in.
00300    * @param from - original character to be replaced.
00301    * @param to - character to do the replacing with.
00302    */
00303   static void subChar(std::string &s, char from, char to) {
00304     std::string::size_type pos = 0;
00305     for(pos = 0; pos < s.size(); pos++) {
00306       if(s[pos] == from) {
00307         s[pos] = to;
00308       }
00309     }
00310   }
00311

00319    * @param to - string to do the replacing with.

00321   static void replaceString(std::string &s, const std::string &from, const std::string &to);

00325   static void removeChar(std::string &s, char character) {
00326     std::ostringstream buf;
00327     for (size_t i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
00328       if (s.at(i) != character) {
00329         buf << s.at(i);
00330       }
00331     }
00332     s = buf.str();
00333   }

00335   static bool is32Bit() {
00336     bool is32 = true;
00337     int nBytes = sizeof(size_t);
00338     if (nBytes == 4) {
00339       is32 = true;
00340     }
00341     else if (nBytes == 8) {
00342       is32 = false;
00343     }
00344 #ifdef _WIN64
00345     is32 = false;
00346 #endif
00347 #ifdef __LP64__
00348     is32 = false;
00349 #endif
00350     return is32;
00351   }

00437   static std::string escapeString(const std::string &s, char c, char escape='\\') {
00438     std::string e;
00439     e.reserve(s.size());
00440     for (size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); i++) {
00441       if (s[i] == c || s[i] == escape) {
00442         e.push_back(escape);
00443       }
00444       e.push_back(s[i]);
00445     }
00446     return e;
00447   }
00448 
00449   static std::string deEscapeString(std::string &s, char escape='\\') {
00450     std::string e;
00451     e.reserve(s.size());
00452     for (size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); i++) {
00453       if (s[i] == escape) {
00454         i++;
00455       }
00456       e.push_back(s[i]);
00457     }
00458     return e;
00459   }

00461   static std::wstring toWString( const std::string &src ) {
00462     std::wstring dst( src.length(), L' ');
00463     std::copy( src.begin(), src.end(), dst.begin());
00464     return dst;
00465   }
00466   static std::string toString( const std::wstring &src );

00468 private:
00469     class StaticMem {
00470         public:
00471             StaticMem() {
00472                 uint64_t freeRam = 0, totalRam = 0, swapAvail = 0, memAvail = 0;
00473                 Util::memInfo(freeRam, totalRam, swapAvail, memAvail, false);
00474                 m_MemFreeAtStart.push_back(memAvail);
00475             }
00476             uint64_t getMemFreeAtStart() {
00477                 return m_MemFreeAtStart[0];
00478             }
00479             uint64_t getMemFreeAtBlock() {
00480                 return m_MemFreeAtStart[m_MemFreeAtStart.size()-1];
00481             }
00482             void pushMemFreeAtStart(uint64_t mem) {
00483                 m_MemFreeAtStart.push_back(mem);
00484             }
00485             uint64_t popMemFreeAtStart() {
00486                 uint64_t mem = m_MemFreeAtStart[m_MemFreeAtStart.size()-1];
00487                 m_MemFreeAtStart.pop_back();
00488                 return mem;
00489             }
00490 
00491         private:
00492             std::vector<uint64_t> m_MemFreeAtStart;
00493     };
